meanings.definition: A pin or bolt on which another part pivots or rotates.
meanings.sent1: The door swung smoothly on its pintles.
meanings.sent2: The gate's pintles allowed it to open and close easily.
meanings.sent3: The pintles on the gate whispered to each other as it moved.
meanings.sent4: Her ideas pivoted around the pintles of creativity.
meanings.sent5: The pintles of the clockwork mechanism clicked into place.

meanings.definition: A vertical pin or bolt on which a hinge is mounted.
meanings.sent1: The cabinet door's pintles kept it attached securely.
meanings.sent2: The old wooden door creaked on its rusty pintles.
meanings.sent3: The pintles on the gate played hide and seek with the hinges.
meanings.sent4: His trust was the pintles on which their relationship hinged.
meanings.sent5: The pintles of the bridge held the weight of the passing cars.

meanings.definition: A pin or bolt on which a rudder is hung.
meanings.sent1: The boat's pintles allowed for smooth steering.
meanings.sent2: The sailor adjusted the rudder's pintles before setting sail.
meanings.sent3: The pintles on the rudder danced a jig in the water.
meanings.sent4: Her guidance was the pintles on which the team's success hung.
meanings.sent5: The pintles of the ship's rudder were well-oiled for the journey.
